Frame.Nav: Handy storage compartment and windshield fluid reservoir are easily accessible.
The standard backfill blade allows an operator to dig a trench along a foundation, position a pipe and backfill with one versatile machine.
For added versatility, two arm lengths are available: a 5-foot, 7-inch arm for maximum lift capacity and breakout, and a 6-foot, 11-inch arm for applications that require additional reach.
Upper glass panel self stores overhead.
Lower glass panel can be removed for improved forward visibility and self stores inside cab.
An ergonomically designed cab features controls that are designed to comfortably fit varying sized operators.
Air conditioning – controls shown here – is standard equipment on the CX80 excavator.
Built-up material from job site is easier to remove with tapered track guards. Rubber link tracks are optional.
Reinforced boom for extended life. Single- or double-acting hydraulics are available.
Cab door designed for easy entry/exit.
Side panel allows access to dual-element air filter. Dual-element filter provides finer filtration.

The powerful CX80 excavator features a bucket-digging force of up to 12,792 lbs. (56.9 kN). Varying-sized buckets are available. General bucket widths range from 18 to 30 inches (0.45 to 0.76 m); 0.25 to 0.50 cubic yards (0.18 to 0.34 m3). Ditching bucket widths range from 42 to 48 inches (1.06 to 1.21 m); 0.6 to 0.7 cubic yards (0.46-0.54 m3).
Powerful Tier 2 certified engine delivers 52 horsepower (38.77 kW).
Daily maintenance checks are easily accomplished from ground level access points.
Cap on fuel tank readily accessible on right rear of machine.

Nav.SubTitle: Easy access to hydraulic motors and tanks

Frame.Nav: Hinged panel provides easy access to all motors and tanks.
Strategically placed panels provide access to coolers at ground level.
Arm digging force up to 8,610 lbs. (38.3 kN)
A tight swing radius of 5 feet, 4 inches allows the excavator to work in even the most cramped spaces.

Versatile center swing boom can be positioned anywhere within a 130-degree arc. An operator can use the machine as a standard excavator, or swing the boom on an angle to accommodate any challenging application.
